bug.short_desc: network errors are saved as partial files, makes future downloads corrupted
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: When some download fails, this is saved as .part file: $ less ~/Download/Fedora-Workstation-Live-x86_64-24-1.2.iso.part 404 Not Found

Not Found

The requested URL /pub/fedora/linux/releases/24/Workstation/x86_64/iso/Fedora-Workstation-Live-x86_64-24-1.2.iso was not found on this server.

404 Not Found

Not Found

The requested URL /pub/fedora/linux/releases/24/Workstation/x86_64/iso/Fedora-Workstation-Live-x86_64-24-1.2.iso was not found on this server.

Now when I try to download the image again, it *resumes* the download with that offset. Which means the first x kilobytes of that file will be incorrect and the checksum verification will fail. Network errors must not be saved as .part files. Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): mediawriter-3.96.0-0.fc25.x86_64 How reproducible: always Steps to Reproduce: 1. create .part file with incorrect contents 2. download the image using mediawriter 3. see that the downloaded file is not correct
